item.title: Who was Heraclitus?
item.description: Not much is actually known about Heraclitus. Here’s what historians think they know. Heraclitus was an early Greek philosopher. He came from the Greek city of Ephesus, in Asia Minor area known as Ionia, populated by Greek-speaking people, but under the control of the Persian empire of the time. There is a myth or legend or story that he was at least an honorary king of Ionia, but there is not much evidence of that.
